citeinfo.title: Geologic Atlas of McLeod County, Minnesota (Part A)

descript.abstract:
A County Geologic Atlas is a systematic study of a county's geologic and ground water resources. Geologic studies include both near-surface deposits and bedrock. Ground water studies include flow systems, aquifer capacity, and ground water chemistry. In some areas sand and gravel deposits, sinkholes, or other features are studied. Interpretation of sensitivity to pollution is also part of an atlas. The information is organized, analyzed, and displayed using geographic information technology.
Most Geologic Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment projects are done in two parts. The Minnesota Geological Survey covers basic geology and creates databases of information such as wells and soil borings in part A. The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) handles hydrogeology and ground water sensitivity layers in Part B. Completion of a project's two parts is staggered: Part A is completed about two years before Part B, compiling information used to create part B. Parts A and B are published and distributed as two separate products.
descript.purpose: County Geologic Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment information is used in planning and environmental protection efforts at all levels of government. Wellhead protection and well-sealing programs are examples of local programs that need geologic and ground water information. The information is also used by businesses and the general public.

timeperd.current: Digital files used to compile the McLeod County Geologic Atlas, Part A, were developed 2006-2008. Geologic maps were created based on information available to MGS during the period 2006-2008.

theme.themekey: geoscientificInformation, Bedrock Geology, Surficial Geology, Bedrock Topography, Depth to Bedrock, Drift Thickness,Wells, Mineral Resources, Mineral Endowment

idinfo.useconst: Credit should be given to the Minnesota Geological Survey for any use of the given digital data in any publication.

citeinfo.title:
C-20, Part A. Geologic Atlas of McLeod County, Minnesota. Barbara Lusardi, Project Manager. 2009. Color. 6 plates. Scales 1:100,000 and 1:200,000. Paper map and report available from MGS Map Sales Office (2609 Territorial Road, St. Paul, Minnesota, 55114, 612-626-2969.)
For a listing of all geologic maps go to the Minnesota Geological Survey website at: http://www.mngs.umn.edu/mgsdocs.html
For a complete listing of MGS State Map Series Maps, Reports, and GIS Data, see http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/708
For other County Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment data see: http://www.mngs.umn.edu/county_atlas/countyatlas.htm
For a listing of the status of the DNR Ground Water Mapping Program, go to: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/waters/groundwater_section/mapping/index.html

procstep.procdesc: Investigations begin with a review of existing information, such as earlier geologic maps, soil maps, and hydrologic reports. Drillers send water well logs to the Minnesota Geological Survey, where they are reviewed, interpreted, and entered into the County Well Index (CWI), an interactive data base of water-well information. Building on the previous data, field studies are conducted to improve the understanding of local geologic and hydrologic conditions. Linework is created based upon the field studies and base data, and digitized. Background GIS data layers such as roads, surface hydrography, township grids, etc., are obtained from various sources. See also individual layer metadata files.

overview.eaover:
List of ArcInfo coverages provided for McLeod county geologic atlas. The coverages are in ESRI file interchange format with an .e00 extension. Coordinate system for all files is UTM NAD83 Zone 15N.
al_pg--polygon coverage of alluvial sediment
bgnt--net coverage of bedrock geology containing polygons and arcs
gmln--polyline coverage of Quaternary land surface geomorphic features
hummock--polygon coverage showing areas of hummocky land surface
outwash--polygon coverage of Quaternary outwash sediments
papg--county polygon outline
peat--polygon coverage of peat
rspg--polygon coverage showing location and potential of aggregate resources
sgpg--polygon coverage of Quaternary surficial geology
siltcap--polygon coverage showing location and extent of silt cover

stdorder.ordering:
Data download is from the U of M Libraries Digital Conservancy. All GIS data and metadata for the McLeod County Geologic Atlas is provided in the zip file C20_Extras.zip (Supplementary Files).
If you would prefer to have the digital data on DVD, contact MGS Map Sales office at (612) 626-2969.
The direct Digital Conservancy link to PDF map products and GIS data projects (Supplementary Files) for this data set is: http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/58781
If you would like paper copies of the geologic plates; contact the MGS Map Sales office at 612-626-2969 and specify publication County Atlas Series C-20, part A, or County Geologic Atlas of McLeod County.
